channel.title: George Kent Allen
channel.description: Recent content on George Kent Allen

item.title: Small Bugs Are Hard to See.
item.description: The Puzzle Take a look at the following code. #include <iostream> #include <string> int main() { int number_integer = -1; std::string number_string = "11"; number_integer = std::stoi(number_string); std::cout << "The number is " << number_integer; number_string = "ll" ; number_integer = std::stoi(number_string); std::cout << "The has changed to " << number_integer; } Here it appears as if number_string is assigned a valid value, "11", upon it’s initialization, so that it can be converted to an integer by the call to std::stoi just a line after.
